qas.question: Where can you buy downloadable content for the PSP and PS3?
What do you click on in the PS3 interface to get to the PlayStation Store?
What connection would you go through to go to the PS3 store from a PSP?
How many unique downloads had there been from the PlayStation Store by late 2009?
From a PC, what application can you use to visit the PlayStation Store?
Where can you buy uploadable content for the PSP and PS3?
What do you click on in the PS2 interface to get to the PlayStation Store?
What connection would you go through to go to the PS3 store from a PS2?
How many unique downloads had there been from the PlayStation Store by late 2008?
From a PC, what application can't you use to visit the PlayStation Store?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>The PlayStation Store<b5_0/><a0_0/> is an online virtual market available to users of Sony's PlayStation 3 (PS3) and PlayStation Portable (PSP) game consoles via the PlayStation Network. The Store offers a range of downloadable content both for purchase and available free of charge. Available content includes full games, add-on content, playable demos, themes and game and movie trailers. The service is accessible through <a1_0><b6_0>an icon<b6_0/><a1_0/> on the XMB on PS3 and PSP. The PS3 store can also be accessed on PSP via a <a2_0><b7_0>Remote Play<b7_0/><a2_0/> connection to PS3. The PSP store is also available via the PC application, <a4_0><b9_0>Media Go<b9_0/><a4_0/>. As of September 24, 2009, there have been <a3_0><b8_0>over 600 million<b8_0/><a3_0/> downloads from the PlayStation Store worldwide.
